reviews.review: Very nice game and nice storyline.

Este juego es una porquería. No tiene historia, ni secuencias en video, las campañas no siguen una trayectoria argumental, el juego está lleno de bugs, la inteligencia artificial te hace perder cualquier rastro de cordura, debido a que son bastante estúpidos, el juego es lineal a lo más básico, empiezas en un punto A y debes llegar al punto B, y lo peor, no hay sistema para guardar tus partidas, debes acabar una campaña completa sin parar, si se va la energía eléctrica, tu mascota te apaga el PC o cualquier otro infortunio, pierdes el progreso. Soy de esos gamer que gusta de coleccionar sus propias partidas guardadas, es un demostrativo de la completitud de mis juegos, y si en un futuro nostálgico, me antojo de rejugar uno de mis juegos, tendré mi antigua partida ahí disponible.

En fin, tiene demasiados puntos en contra, tanto que parece un juego indie (generalizando), o un juego inacabado.

Pero entonces, ¿Por qué lo estoy recomendando?
Es un juego absurdamente adictivo, como pueden ver, he superado las 100 horas de juego. Es muy disfrutable si lo juegas en partidas privadas con uno o varios amigos, pasarán un rato bastante agradable.

Lo único que me queda de este juego, son los logros Steam que he superado, los cuales dependen de la existencia de Valve.

You may never have more fun playing co-op than when you do so in this game. 
OR if you want to be the best in the campaign, go with singleplayer. 
No one will judge you. 
No one.

Rather simplistic shooting game. The storyline of the offline single player was non existent. There could've been more weapon choises and different strategies, like sneak kill.

To me this game is pretty good and here is why.

But as I always say these are my thoughts you can have your own but these are mine.

The goods

Four playable characters such as Bill/Francis/Louis/and Zoey (Not a big fan of zoey for my own reasons.)

A pretty good amount of levels to play around in.

The game does take team work.

Three game modes to play such as Campaign (The Storyish Mode.) survival fighting a never ending amount of zombies and alike and vs where you vs players in human vs special infected matchs.

I do like how they made the levels also.

Can see your own legs (Opionion)

Ragdoll deaths for survivors (Opionion)

People made custom Campaigns. (will also be a part of this in the bads area.)

The bads

Not as many players as Left 4 Dead 2

May have levels created by other people but does not have steam workshop. So you will have to do more work going on sites and downloading levels and placeing them in the right spot. (Yep i said there would be a part to that one up there that was going to be in the bads.)

Now and again on expert you will get a random person who joins and kills the whole team for fun. Or even worse kills them all when the rescue arrives at the end of a campaign and then wins by them selfs and quits

Some times have to use to much team work and every one else may want to try to be a super soldier and fight on there own.

hit box can be a little off at times but not the worse.

The Vote Kick System can be awful not because of the system it self, But thing is based on how people act. In other words people who say vote kick is the answer to every thing will abuse it.

What Left 4 Dead has That Left 4 Dead 2 does not

Its own survival mode levels While Left 4 dead 2 has two of no mercys and all of the sacrafices survival levels the rest of the Left 4 Deads survival Levels are only in Left 4 Dead

Can see your own characters legs

Ragdoll deaths For Survivors

Tanks were less nice if they knocked you down most of the time they would beat you to death rather then go for the others. Meaning that most of the time you would have three and not four people now. Also tank ran faster on fire so burning him would mean he can run faster then you now.

All the weapons and special infected have different stats.

Overall

I say give it a try if you have friends to play with because all the campaigns from Left 4 Dead made it into Left 4 Dead 2. But you will not have the stuff that was only in Left 4 Dead and the level lay outs are a little Different for these levels in Left 4 Dead 2 but keep in mind you only get all of the survival maps from Left 4 Dead if you own Left 4 Dead While in Left 4 Dead 2 you still get two of No Mercys and all the Sacrafice ones from Left 4 Dead. 

What i am trying to say mostly get Left 4 Dead if you have a few friends who will play it you want to see how Left 4 Dead was compaired to Left 4 Dead 2 or you Like Survival Mode.

I remember being sooo hyped for this game when it came out. The game consist of 4 special zombies including a tank,smoker, hunter, and a boomer. The game has around 5  chapters and each chapter has about 5 parts to each chapter. The game is addicting and really fun.. I recommend left 4 dead whenever it goes on sale in a bundle. Game is totally worth it and there is no steam workshop on the game, but their are some amazing mods to the game!!

It's fast and frantic, but so fun! I've spent many hours with family blasting away zombies while constantly cursing the AI for  using a medkit on the hint of scratch. Highly recommended.

Genial juego que popularizo el modo cooperativo. El modo individual resulta entretenido aunque su punto fuerte es sin suda el multijugador. Permite elegir el bando de los humanos o de los zombies, cada uno con sus pros y sus contras. De graficos utiliza tecnologia half life source y la jugabilidad muy buena. Tiene unos cuantos bugs pero no son relevantes.

La historia lo más simple posible y sin embargo de lo más efectiva, grupo de 4 supervivientes a una epidemia que deben ir de un punto A a un punto B para que les rescaten. Por el camino decenas de infectados y zombies especiales intentando matarles.

Отличная игра!

The zombie apocalypse is here and that's the entire story you need to know in this cooperative first-person shooter and all the story you're ever told. You play as 1 of 4 survivors (Zoey the college student, Bill the war veteran, Francis the biker, Louis the IT guy). The character doesn't seem to matter, it's just a different voice and skin. They will talk to alert you of things like health, weapons, reloading and where you should go next. Left 4 Dead is geared toward online multiplayer, but you can play solo through the game where your computer partners are competent enough, but need to be guided by you. Instead of online multiplayer where the other players seem to just run right through each level.

The controls are simple, point and click to shoot like any first person shooter, right mouse button is for melee for when foes swarm around you and they will. You have a long range weapon (shotguns, oozies, assault rifles and so on), a pistol (or 2) with limitless ammo, a medipack to restore your health or someone else's, pain pills that will temporarily give you a health boost and finally an explosive thrown weapon like a flaming cocktail or pipe bomb. You can jump or crouch for better weapon accuracy and that's it. The combat feels very limited because of this.

The big drawing point to the game is some sort of smart engine called the director that will generate random zombies to come at you, so no play through is the same twice. Such as a zombie that was at point A of your first play through might be a wall of zombies or no zombies, or a female zombie in your next play through. These zombies will race toward you after a few moments of shuffling their feet that might result in your terror, but an entire game of zombies running to you gets old very quickly. Zombies can climb up areas, go under truck trailers and the animations are good in general. Weapons and ammo scattered outside of safe rooms will not be in the same place twice.

The game is broken into campaigns and levels that you can access any one at any time. The campaigns are brief and really take you out of the action when you need to load a new campaign after completing one. The levels have good atmosphere, dark, spooky, but it gets old very quickly. Most every level feels the same with generic buildings, generic exteriors, generic trucks.

Between the levels are safe rooms. Leave a safe room and make it to the next safe room to cap off the level. Then at the end of the level, you see your score and how you did against the other players. Who killed the most zombies, who took the most damage. Stuff like that.

To be honest it's not that good. It feels very one dimensional. Within the first few levels, you've seen all the game has to offer. You will quickly see all of its small variety of enemies zombies run straight at you, witches that stay huddled until you put a light on them, stalkers pounce on you until you are saved, smokers use a tongue to strangle you until you are saved and explode smoke, exploders that vomit on you and tanks that can throw you and take a giant amount of punishment. You will really need to rely on others for survival. The computer players will be very willing to help you, but the players in multiplayer may not be as willing or can't when you've been left behind or gone ahead.

That's it. The game isn't very long and for a game that touts its random enemy generator, it doesn't make me want to replay the game again and again. Combat is simple, enemy variety is lacking, but the game plays very smooth. Essentially left for dead is about mowing down tons of zombies and if that's your thing, this is the game for you. If you need puzzles in your FPS or weapon depth, it's not for you.

Left 4 Dead offers the best zombie fighting experience I've had gaming and with great play functionality allowing gamers from all walks of life to start playing without experience. The more casual gamers may sadly get tired of the repetitiveness that zombie killing produces even with several campaigns on offer. Online multiplayer does however offer fun extras to the game as does the variety of zombies included in the storymode. And who doesn't love a great zombie slayer game?

[h1]8/10[/h1]

[u]Pros/Cons[/u]

+ A good variety of zombies (provided by the "specials") and the multiplayer mode mixes up gameplay.
+ The decent graphics and well integrated audio make for a well-rounded gaming experience.
+ Killing zombies  is a hugely fun novelty compared to most of the modern FPS games of today.
+ Smooth game mechanics with a brilliant pick-up and play style make this an excellent game for all.
 
- There is no doubt a lack of content given that this game relies on replaying the campaigns.
- Even the different campaigns get slightly repetitive as you play them through for the first time.
It's preeeeettttyyyyy good.

For a guy who was introduced to FPS with N64's Goldeneye, I was really impressed with L4D. The background items and members of the zombie horde are a little vanilla (i.e. repetative), but the game is still incredibly fun, regardless. After all, you're not really critiquing the fact that all the zombies with the green shirt are all missing their left eye in-game...because you're too busy trying to shoot them before they can zig, zag, and mob you to death. As far as I can tell, as you increase the difficulty, the normal infected become more alert, dangerous, and ready to jack you up, and the number of special infected spawning through the map really ramps up. The four difficulty levels offered are very distinct and predictable - which, personally, I see as a huge plus. You know what you're in for when you select a harder difficulty. In fairness, I'm going to rate this game based on what came before it, not after. And for fun, replayability, single and multiplayer diversity, and even having a decent story, my verdict is 4.6/5.

Left 4 Dead is a fun little 4-player Survival FPS set during the Zombie Apocalypse. 
There's not too much to be said about it story-wise (our heroes make their way across Zombie-infested environments... Walking-Dead-level-sh*t does NOT ensue) and the gameplay is just your Standard Source-engine FPS fare only you aren't a lone soldier carrying impossibly large loads of munitions into impossible situations to shoot a thing in the face. You're one in a team of four humorously-written characters (Bill, Louis, Francis, and Zoey) getting from point A to Point B without getting overwhelmed by Zombies and Super Zombies and level-based tricks the engine decides to put in your path. If you're through with either the Campaign or the multitiude of user-made campaigns, you can see how long you'd hold out against waves of the undead in survival mode.

Bem, é difícil um gamer que nunca tenha tido contato com Left 4 Dead. L4D é um jogo coop, no qual você e seus companheiros (geralmente 4 players no total) precisam enfrentar hordas e hordas de zumbis até chegar em um objetivo. Falando assim, até parece um joguinho meia boca, mas não é bem assim não... Depois de uma experiência como gamer, percebi que a Valve pegou uma grande inspiração em Killing Floor em certos aspectos da mecânica de gameplay, e, depois que percebi isso, achei muito incrível, pois sou um grande fã de KF. A mecânica do gameplay de L4D é simples e bastante intuitiva: Você precisa matar os zumbis em seu caminho, e sempre ir buscando abrigo. Cada campanha tem diferentes fases, e no final de cada delas, tem uma safe zone que termina a fase para começar a próxima. No final da última fase, os sobreviventes entram em algum veículo e saem da campanha que jogaram. E é no meio de tudo isso que começam as particularidades de L4D: No jogo não há diferenças entre os players, todos são sobreviventes iguais, com a mesma quantidade de HP, e sem nenhuma habilidade especial. O arsenal não é muito vasto, porém, cada arma tem suas particularidades e seus pontos fortes, e além das armas, existem as bombas e os medkits para ajudar os jogadores. E, dentre os seus inimigos, existem os infectados especiais. Cada um deles possui habilidades diferentes para dificultar ainda mais a vida dos sobreviventes. E além de tudo, tem o Tank... Nem preciso comentar nada sobre o Tank, né? E, o ponto mais forte de Left é o modo coop, em que 2 times se enfrentam: Um de infectados e um de sobreviventes. É um modo muito divertido, porém foi superado em diversão pelo seu sucessor. L4D é, sem dúvidas, um marcador de águas em jogos coop de zumbis. 8/10

Ah, it's a classic. Whatever platform you own this on, fun times are to be had.
 You take control of one of four survivors of the Green Flu (Virus?), a nasty disease turning the population into flesh-eating horrors. The rest of the survivors are either A.I., or players (treat the A.I. nicely, and you shall be rewarded). You then proceed to embark on a journey from safehouse to safehoue, 'till the finale, where you must hold out for an amount of time before escape is available. In order to even make it to the finale, or move on at all, tight teamwork is needed. You can share items, heal others, and use z and x to say things such as Help and similar call-outs (after all this time, i still don't know what they're called. Voice commands? I don't know. Someone tell me.) to further help the team.
 Now, about the zombies. They are fast. They come in large groups. They are smart. There are certain events which cause them to come in endless hordes, unless something is done that stops them from being attracted. Or the A.I. Director (the thing controlling all the zombies) can send a horde (this one is NOT endless) your way if you spend too much time in one place, or if it feels like it.
 There are special infected (each special infected has their own music que, and there can be only around 3 in-game at a time) The Boomer spits bile at you, attratcing zombies. He explodes when shot, showering you in bile. He can also detonate at will, so if he's in your face, shove him away before shooting, or before he explodes.  The Smoker produces a long tounge that drags it's prey to it, where it then claws the living hell out of you. Shoot the tounge, or shoot it before then (it likes to stay far away form the group, so be careful). The Hunter can jump super long distances and great heights, screaming every time. He will pounce on you, clawing you until soemone gets him off, or kills him.   The Tank. The name speaks for itself. This thing is insanely strong, requiring the whole group to put it down. Each punch stuns you and sends you flying. Also, he can throw cars. Fun.    Finally, the Witch.  If you hear any crying women, turn your flashlights off and stay away. Sneak around her. You can shoot her, just expect her to make a beeline for whoever disturbed her, and proceed to down you in one hit. She also has very large health, and does the most damage in the game. 
Well, that's all there is. It's a great game to play with friends, or alone. Multiplayer matches, or no. A must-have.

There is mixed feelings with Left 4 Dead, I find if you play a lot of Zombie games then this is a little tame for you, with just the countless amounts of shooting, there's not a huge amount of strategy. However I think it's great. There's nothing more zen than taking shotgun and pumping a s***t tonne of zombies full of lead, the graphics are pretty hilarious and as long as you work as a team it's fun all round.

Was soll ich zu Left 4 Dead schreiben sagen wir es so es war mein erstes Zombie Game und es war glaub ich zumindestens zu der Zeit das beste wenn nicht sogar eines der einzigsten richtigen Zombie Games die es gegeben hat. Man vergleicht mit heute wo fast in jedem Game Zombies vorkommen und die unglaublich schlecht gemacht sind. L4d ist ein gutes Zombie Game das man sowohl im Single als auch Multiplayer spielen kann obwohl ich deutlich sagen muss das der Multiplayer besser ist vor allem das man noch Addon Maps runterladen kann und Spielen kann ist auch sehr Positiv. L4d besitzt aber zu viele Bugs die zum Teil das Spielen unmöglich machen und im Multiplayer kann es zwischendurch oder mehrfach Spieler geben die einen einfach nur aufhalten oder Tot schiessen und sich dann selber töten nur um einen die Kampagne kapput zu machen. Man kann zwischen 4 Charkatern auswählen die gut in das Spiel reinpassen. Über die Bots schreibe ich jetzt mal nichts weil man die eh nicht gebrauchen kann so wie es in den meisten Spielen der Fall ist. Die auswahl der Offiziellen Maps von L4d ist sehr Mager und mit 6 Maps nicht gerade der Hit aber man kann ja Addon Maps hinzufügen wie weiter oben beschrieben. Ich hab das Spiel solange gespielt das ich eine geteilte Meinung über das Spiel hab es macht Spass aber mit der Zeit ist es einfach nur Stinklangweilig und das macht der Multiplayer auch nicht gut und die Addon Maps. Aber ich würde es empfehlen zu kaufen.
Das Spiel ist cool, aber holt euch lieber L4D2, da alle Maps, die es in L4D gibt, auch in L4D2 sind.

I play this game for an entirely different reason than I would play Left 4 Dead 2. Both games are meant to be cooperative, but after getting rather good at L4D1, I feel that it's somewhat broken in terms of your partners being indispensable. 

In L4D2, you absolutely need to work together as a team in order to accomplish your goals. If there's inexperienced people on your team or if you end up playing with bots, the challenge becomes much more difficult. Some of the guns have been nerfed in order to reinforce the need for partners. Also, you can't melee forever, like you are able to do in the first game. Your character eventually fatigues and your character will start to melee more slowly after a while. The maps are designed to prevent the group from hunkering down in a corner and waiting out the horde. Instead, you are meant to run and gun, trying to lessen the amount of damage you will take, since you can't hide in a corner and melee, which would allow you to prevent taking any damage at all. The finales are much more varied and definitely require some teamwork. Without human players backing you up, the finales on some of the new maps would be near impossible.

In L4D1, on the other hand, the infected are pretty easy to dispel if you stay in huddled in a single squad. All you need your partners for is to give you a shove to save you from the occasional special infected. As long as you stay in a team, you can save each other from any hazard. The game is simplistic and pattern based. All you need to do is follow audio cues to know what to expect. Hear some piano keys playing? A Hunter is nearby. Hear a howl? A horde of zombies is coming. It's at that point that you just look for the nearest building corner and crouch. Then, you melee and shoot until the horde eventually dies. The game is extremely simplistic, once you've learned how to read its cues. The finales are also a very simple pattern of horde, Tank, horde, Tank, followed by the rescue, at which point you have a horde and a Tank at the same time.

It's for this reason that I play it, though. I enjoy playing it while talking to friends or use it as an opportunity to make friends. I can spend hours talking to people while killing zombies. For me, it's like a chatroom with a teambuilding exercise built into it. When I play L4D2, on the other hand, I spend so much time focusing on the task at hand, that I can't stop and chat. Not to mention that it's an entirely different gaming experience, which I have yet to acclimate to. In other words, I still suck at L4D2, so I can't easily chat and play at the same time. So, for how I use it, I definitely recommend L4D1.

Left 4 Dead is a action/adventure horror game. The story is about a ex-Vietnam soldier, an manager of a administration organisation, a biker who is a member of the fictional Hell's angels and a  Girl which has alot of knowledge about zombie movies and skill as her father who was a police officer. They survived two weeks the infection. Now its your choice if they will survive longer or not by diving into one of those four's situations. Fighting massive hordes of infected and also Infected that are related to the Four's history. (Smoker related to bill, Hunter related to Zoey, Boomer related to Francis.)
This game is totally worth a try

Fun game

Sin duda estamos ante un muy buen juego de matar zombies.

En este juego no te esperes una historia donde te expliquen que es lo que ha pasado, o siquiera algo de los pèrsonajes con los que te relacionas, aqui la historia se deja de lado y lo importante es sobrevivir a las oleadas de zombies a traves de cada escenario, colaborando con otros 3 amigos para llegar todos sanos y salvos al siguiente refugio, tiene tres modos de juego:

MODO CAMPAÑA: Cada campaña esta dividida en capítulos en cada uno de los cuales debemos atravesar zonas infestadas de enemigos para llegar a los refugios, unas zonas seguras fortificadas donde empezarán y terminarán los capítulos, excepto el ultimo, donde sera una defensa desesperado durante un determinado tiempo hasta que llegue la evacuación. Deberemos colaborar con nuestros compañeros, pues la IA del juego nos tenderá emboscadas y nos atacará con oleadas de zombies e infectados especiales cuando menos lo esperemos, o mas jodidos estemos. Este es uno de los puntos fuertes del juego, exceptuando algunos, la gran mayoria de hordas e infectados especiales que nos atacarán seran aleatorias, podemos jugar un mapa varias veces, que los enemigos atacarán en distintos puntos cada vez.

SUPERVIVENCIA: Deberemos resistir el maximo tiempo posible en algunos mapas de la campaña contra una interminable horda de zombis, conseguir llegar a 10 minutos es poco menos que un milagro, en este modo aparecerán un monton de infectados especiales.

ENFRENTAMIENTO: En este modo se formarán dos equipos, uno controlará a los supervivientes y otro controlará a los infectados especiales, son los mapas de la campaña, de hecho los supervivientes deben llegar al refugio, y los infectados intentar impedirselo.

Podemos controlar a 4 personajes distintos que son supervivientes resistentes a la infección, estos son:
ZOEY: Una estudiante universitaria
BILL: Veterano de Vietnam
LOUIS: Un oficinista negro
FRANCIS: Un motorista, prototipo de tipo duro
A pesar de ser distintos, no tienen habilidades ni estadisticas que los diferencien a unos de otros, por lo que realmente da igual a quien coger a la hora de jugar.

Entre los infectados especiales se encuentran:

SMOKER: Un capullo de primera, atacará desde lejos a veces desde angulos casi imposibles, nos atrapará con su lengua y nos arrastrará hacia el, si no nos salvan de el nos asfixiará o dejará que los zombies nos devoren.

BOOMER: El mas lento y debil, se trata de un gordo que escupe un moco, que a demas de dejarnos temporalmente ciegos atraerá a una horda de zombies hacia los supervivientes que acaben manchados con el, mucho cuidado con matarlo de lejos, pues de cerca explotará cubriéndonos de moco

HUNTER: Pequeño, agil y rapido, si nos pilla nos destrozará con sus garras

WICH: La oiremos llorando en algunas partes del escenario, podemos evitarla apagando luces y avanzando en silencio o ir a por ella y arriesgarnos a que destroce al atacante

TANK: Su nombre lo dice todo, parece un culturista mutante con exceso de esteroides, lento pero duro, a pesar de que un superviviente corre mas que el, tiene la posibilidad de arrancar piedras del suelo y arrojarlas derribando a sus victimas, una autentica maquina de matar si tiene coches a su alcance.
